title: Angular Displacement of Edge of Object

content.question: A graph of the angular velocity <math alttext="omega" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown for an object that rotates about an axis. Three time intervals, <math alttext="1 minus 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">–</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, are shown. Which of the following correctly compares the angular displacement <math alttext="delta theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the object during each time interval?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta theta sub 1 equals delta theta sub 3 which is greater than delta theta sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta theta sub 2 is greater than delta theta sub 1, which is equal to delta theta sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta theta sub 3 is greater than delta theta sub 2, which is greater than delta theta sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta theta sub 1 is greater than delta theta sub 2, which is greater than delta theta sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta theta sub 2 is greater than delta theta sub 1, which is equal to delta theta sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
